I’m holding the entire Uvalde community in my heart today.

And I’ll keep fighting to pass commonsense gun safety measures and finally put an end to the gun violence crisis in America.

We can raise the minimum age to purchase assault-style weapons.

We can strengthen background checks and red flag laws.

We can secure our schools and invest in mental health care.

We can do more to prevent future tragedies. And we must.

In the 365 days since, lawmakers in statehouses and in Congress have failed to pass the kind of sweeping, meaningful reform that could have prevented this tragedy.

I refuse to accept such violence as normal. Because it's not.

And we have the power to act.

No one should have to pay more for health care services based only on the location of care.

From @AlexSchriver of @bettersol4hc:
This measure will end dishonest hospital billing and lower prices for employers and consumers by ensuring that patients are billed for the services they receive at the location where they receive them.

From @HealthCareFight:
Patients should not have to pay more simply because a hospital buys a doctor’s office & engages in billing practices that obscure the location of care. 

The FAIR Act injects transparency into hospital billing to ensure patients pay for service provided.

P4ESC commends Hern and Kuster for their bipartisan bill targeting big hospital systems that charge consumers and employer plans far higher costs by defining a doctor’s office as a HOSPITAL through consolidation. Shame on them!

The FAIR Act, by addressing a commonsense billing issue, will increase much needed transparency and lead to significant savings overall for taxpayers, employers, unions, and patients.
